June 10, I960
Mr. Harold E. Hill, Vice President
National Association of Educational
Broadcasters
111 Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
M JWHIWO
i
Dear Harold:
Thanks for the counting in your June 3 letter. Actually,
the difficulty is going to be with the July 1 deadline. I have
asked Arnold Thorson, our Office Manager, to get together the
list of calls and other items that are related to this project
and as soon as that is ready I will send it to you for payment.
It certainly should be there before the first of July. On the
other hand, I have several projected trips dealing with these
pilot kits but cannot make these until later in the summer. This
is unfortunate and may mean that we will have to cancel these
planned trips. I would like to make an alternate suggestion and
you can certainly decide whether this is possible or advisable.
Should you end up with some money in this grant that you want to
apply to the project, we could send you a bill for consultant's
service in almost any amount you say. If this could be paid in
advance we would hold it as a balance here which could be applied
towards future work which you would approve towards the development
of the pilots•
It seems almost inexcusable to not use this money. There
are so many things that need to be done and certainly not the
least of which is more work on this utilization project. If
we could get an extension on the use of this money then I feel
sure it would be put to good use.
I will be in Washington from June 19 to July 1. I expect
to spend some time with the people in the U. S. Office and will
try to develop some information on our project. The under-cover
grape vine has indicated we are due for financing of Phase I of
our proposal but since I have not heard from you, I gather that
there has been no official word.
Cordial
lair R. Tettemer
Director of School Programs
CRT: gvc
